short_description: This analytical function can be used to find percentiles on a per group basis.
long_description: This function generates the exact percentiles for a group of numbers. This function works well when the number of groups is big (in the order of > 100s of thousands) and each group is small enough to fit in memory (in the order of 10s of thousands). The exact number depends on the cluster configuration.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The table defining the data on which percentages will be calculated.
input_tables.description: The table defining the data on which percentages will be calculated.

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the groups of numbers whose percentiles are to be generated.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the groups of numbers whose percentiles are to be generated.

argument_clauses.name: GroupColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns to copy to the output table. Typically, the list of group columns is the same as the list of partition columns.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns to copy to the output table. Typically, the list of group columns is the same as the list of partition columns.

argument_clauses.name: Percentile
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the percentiles for the function to generate.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the percentiles for the function to generate.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
